Class DotButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • DotButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class DotButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
    In the application Minesweeper, a DotButton is a specialized type of JButton that represents a square in the game. It can have a number of possible icons, which are found in the "icons" directory. The icon expresses the state of the dot: covered, number of neighbooring mines, exploded.. The icons have been found on wikimedia. The author of these icons seems to be someone called Kazukiokumura.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DotButton

        public DotButton(int column,
                 int row,
                 int iconNumber)
        Constructor used for initializing a DotButton at a specific Board location, with a specific icon.
        Parameters:
        column - the column of this Cell
        row - the row of this Cell
        iconNumber - specifies which iconNumber to use for this cell

    • Method Detail

      • setIconNumber

        public void setIconNumber(int iconNumber)
        Sets the current value of the instance variable iconNumber, and update the iconNumber used by the instance, using the method getImageIcon() to get the new icon.
        Parameters:
        iconNumber - the iconNumber to use, based on the predifined constant values defined in this class
